title: Hall of Fame Goaltender Ken Dryden Dies at 78
snippets: Dryden backstopped the NHL's most successful franchise to championships in six of his eight seasons in the league from 1970-71 to '78-79. He died after a fight with cancer.
Dryden was the anchor of Montreal's dynasty during the 1970s
Ken Dryden, the Hall of Fame goaltender whose resume included six Stanley Cup victories and a stint in the federal cabinet, died Friday at the age of 78 after a battle with cancer.
The hockey world lost one of its most iconic figures on Friday night, as Ken Dryden lost a battle with cancer at age 78.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifEFVX3lxTE96N1RNb3VzWVRYbkg1QmJqRFVpbUhCMDhTQ3ZXcWo0c1JGTWNDTkd3ejF5SVhQN295OWx3ZEZvaVJZbWJ4MlRONXVHak82TDlLbHZmTDJHOWFrcjVHM2o1bEFiLTZDS0RiZGRNdEpBT283d0x1NWxZUEZLMGk?oc=5" target="_blank">Dryden dies at 78, Hall of Fame goalie won Stanley Cup 6 tim

Ken Dryden, the Hall of Fame goaltender whose long resume in and out of hockey included six Stanley Cup victories and helping backstop Canada’s generation-defining victory at the 1972 Summit Series, died Friday at the age of 78 after a battle with cancer.

MONTREAL ‚Äî Ken Dryden, the Hall of Fame goaltender whose long resume in and out of hockey included six Stanley Cup victories and helping backstop Canada’s generation-defining victory at the 1972 Summit Series, died Friday at the age of 78 after a battle with cancer. A key member of the Montrea
titles: Ken Dryden, Hall of Fame goalie for the Montreal Canadiens, dies at age 78

summary: Ken Dryden, a Hall of Fame goaltender who won six Stanley Cups with Montreal and was pivotal in Canada's 1972 Summit Series victory, died at 78 after a battle with cancer. Dryden, celebrated for his role in Montreal's 1970s dynasty and his contributions to hockey and beyond, passed away on Friday.

title: Davey Johnson, World Series Winner as Player and Manager, Dies at 82
snippets: Davey Johnson, the manager of the 1986 world champion New York Mets, has died. He was 82.
Darryl Strawberry called Davey Johnson a 'remarkable leader' in a social media tribute
Davey Johnson, a four-time All-Star in his playing days and who managed the Mets to the 1986 World Series, has died at 82.
Davey Johnson, an All-Star second baseman who won the World Series twice with the Baltimore Orioles as a player and managed the New York Mets to the title in 1986, has died. He was 82.
The late Davey Johnson, who took four teams to the playoffs, still awaits a Cooperstown call.
titles: Davey Johnson, manager of '86 Mets, dies at 82
Davey Johnson dies at 82: MLB manager led Mets to 1986 World Series title
Davey Johnson, manager of 1986 New York Mets, dies at 82
Three-time World Series champion Davey Johnson dies at 82
Davey Johnson, Pilot Of ‚Äò86 Mets Champs, Leaves Great Legacy
summary: Davey Johnson, the former All-Star second baseman who won two World Series with the Baltimore Orioles and managed the New York Mets to their 1986 World Series victory, has passed away at the age of 82. Johnson, celebrated for his leadership and success in both his playing and managerial careers, including taking four teams to the playoffs, was remembered by former Mets player Darryl Strawberry as a 'remarkable leader.' Johnson's contribution to baseball remains recognized, though he has not yet been inducted into the Hall of Fame.

title: Israeli Forces Seize 40% of Gaza City, Escalate Crisis with Tower Demolition
snippets: The Israeli army is systematically destroying remaining infrastructure as it moves to seize Gaza's largest urban centre.

DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) ‚Äî The Israeli army issued evacuation orders and targeted high-rise buildings in famine-stricken Gaza City on Saturday, calling on Palestinians to move to the territory’s south as it escalates operations ahead of a new offensive to seize the city of nearly 1 milli

summary: The Israeli military has taken control of approximately 40% of Gaza City, escalating tensions and causing widespread panic among civilians. The Israeli Defence Minister described the situation as "the gates of hell are opening" in Gaza. In a significant move, Israeli forces demolished the 12-storey Mushtaha tower in Gaza City. This action is part of a broader offensive that has seen the destruction of key infrastructure, leading to a severe humanitarian crisis for the city's residents.

title: Surfer Dies in Shark Attack off Australian Coast; Beaches Closed
snippets: Middle-aged victim reportedly lost both his legs in the attack while his surfboard was cut in half.
A man died Saturday on a beach in Sydney "after being bitten by what is believed to have been a large shark," police said.

Beaches from Manly to Narrabeen closed after death of 57-year-old who leaves behind wife and child

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or
The authorities in Australia closed beaches in the northern Sydney suburbs after the attack.

summary: A 57-year-old surfer died after a shark attack off the coast of Australia, resulting in the loss of both his legs. The incident led to the closure of beaches from Manly to Narrabeen. The victim, who was attacked while surfing, died at the scene and is survived by a wife and child.

title: Sinner to Face Alcaraz in US Open Final, Trump to Attend
snippets: All to know as the world's top two men's tennis players meet in New York in their third straight Grand Slam final.

summary: Jannik Sinner defeated Felix Auger-Aliassime to reach the US Open final, where he will face Carlos Alcaraz, who beat Novak Djokovic in the semi-finals. This marks the third consecutive Grand Slam final between Sinner and Alcaraz. The winner will decide the world No. 1 ranking. US President Donald Trump plans to attend the final in New York.

Settlement shows AI companies can face consequences for pirated training data.

summary: Anthropic has agreed to a $1.5 billion AI copyright settlement, under which it will pay authors $3,000 per book. This deal is seen by legal experts as potentially accelerating the trend towards licensing copyrighted material for AI model training.

title: US Detains 475, Mostly South Koreans, in Georgia Factory Raid
snippets: US immigration officials detained 475 workers on Thursday - most of them South Korean nationals - saying they were working illegally.

Most of the 475 people arrested in a raid on a Hyundai-LG battery factory under construction in the state of Georgia were from South Korea. Relations between Washington and Seoul have become strained of late.
"This, in fact, was the largest single-site enforcement operation in the history of Homeland Security investigations," a DHS official said.
titles: Seoul holds emergency meeting after citizens detained in US Hyundai raid
US: South Koreans detained in ICE raid on Hyundai plant
South Korea responds after ICE detains 475 workers at a Hyundai-LG battery plant in Georgia
summary: US immigration officials detained 475 workers, primarily South Korean nationals, for working illegally at a Hyundai-LG battery factory in Georgia. This event marks the largest single-site enforcement operation by Homeland Security Investigations. The raid has strained relations between the US and South Korea.

snippets: Hundreds of people have gathered in Parliament Square to oppose the group's ban under anti-terrorism legislation.

More than 1,000 people have pledged to risk arrest in demonstration billed as largest since group was proscribed

Arrests have begun at the largest demonstration yet opposing the proscription of Palestine Action.

More than 1,000 people pledged to risk arrest on Saturday at a fresh prot

LONDON (AP) ‚Äî Police on Saturday arrested some of the hundreds of protesters who gathered outside Parliament in London on Saturday to defy a ban on the group Palestine Action, which has been deemed a terrorist organization by the government. Defend Our Juries, the campaign group organizing the prote
titles: Arrests made at rally against Palestine Action ban in London
Police make arrests at London Palestine Action ban protest

summary: Hundreds of protesters gathered in Parliament Square, London, to oppose the ban on Palestine Action, labeled a terrorist organization by the government. Over 1,000 individuals pledged to risk arrest in what has been described as the largest demonstration against the proscription. Police arrested several participants during the event.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Vote on New Contract Post-Strike
snippets: Unionized Air Canada flight attendants will finish voting on a tentative new contract with the airline on Saturday, following a three-day strike earlier this summer.

Flight attendants at Air Canada will wrap up voting on a new contract today at 3 p.m. ET. The tentative deal, which ended a strike at the airline last month, raises wages for workers and establishes a pay structure for time worked when aircraft are on the ground. Voting opened Aug. 27 for the 10,000
titles: Air Canada flight attendants to wrap up vote on new contract Saturday
Air Canada flight attendants to wrap up vote on new contract today
summary: Unionized Air Canada flight attendants are concluding their vote on a tentative contract today, which promises wage increases and a new pay structure for ground time. This deal, aimed at resolving issues that led to a three-day strike last month, affects 10,000 workers. Voting began on August 27.

title: Titans Extend Safety Amani Hooker's Contract for $48.6M
snippets: The Titans and safety Amani Hooker have agreed on a three-year contract extension worth $48.6 million that includes $29 million in guarantees, Hooker's agent told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

Tennessee safety Amani Hooker has signed an extension, keeping one of the Titans‚Äô longest-tenured players with the franchise around past this season.  The Titans announced the multi-year deal Saturday morning ahead of their season opener at Denver.  Financial terms were not included.
titles: Titans, S Hooker strike 3-year, $48.6M extension
Titans sign veteran safety Amani Hooker to a multi-year extension
summary: The Tennessee Titans and safety Amani Hooker have agreed on a three-year contract extension, as confirmed by Hooker's agent to ESPN. The deal is valued at $48.6 million, with $29 million guaranteed. This extension secures Hooker, one of the Titans' longest-tenured players, with the team for the foreseeable future. The Titans officially announced the multi-year extension ahead of their season opener at Denver, though they did not disclose financial details.

title: Alabama WR Williams Out Next Game Due to Concussion

summary: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams, who suffered a concussion in the season opener against Florida State, is currently going through concussion protocol. According to ESPN sources, he is not expected to play in the upcoming game against Louisiana-Monroe.

title: Chargers Beat Chiefs 27-21 in NFL Opener in Brazil, Ending Losing Streak
snippets: The Chargers held on to win at Corinthians Arena in S√£o Paulo in a potentially critical AFC West battle.

Justin Herbert threw for 318 yards and three touchdowns in outdueling Patrick Mahomes, and the Los Angeles Chargers beat Kansas City 27-21 on Friday night in Sao Paulo, snapping a seven-game skid to the Chiefs.
titles: Herbert shines as Chargers earn AFC West win over Chiefs in Brazil
Herbert outduels Mahomes to help Chargers beat Chiefs in Brazil
summary: The Los Angeles Chargers defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 27-21 in their NFL season opener in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. Justin Herbert led the Chargers with 318 passing yards and three touchdowns, outperforming Patrick Mahomes. This victory ended the Chargers' seven-game losing streak against the Chiefs and took place at the Corinthians Arena. Herbert's late-game slide for a first down sealed the win for the Chargers.

summary: Aryna Sabalenka, the defending champion and world No. 1, is set to compete against No. 8 seed Amanda Anisimova in the US Open women's final on Saturday. Both players have faced challenges in Grand Slam tournaments this season, adding a layer of anticipation to the match. The event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports starting at 9pm.

title: Arsenal Defeats London City Lionesses 4-1 in WSL Debut Match
snippets: Arsenal come from behind to win 4-1 against Women's Super League newcomers London City Lionesses.
In their first-ever match in the top flight of the English women‚Äôs game, London City Lionesses lost 4-1 to the European champions Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium.

summary: In their debut Women's Super League match, London City Lionesses were defeated 4-1 by Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium. Despite taking an early lead, the newcomers fell to the European champions, showcasing Arsenal's strength in the competition.

summary: Firefighters have been battling a fire at the former BBC HQ in London's White City for 12 hours. The London Fire Brigade was called to the nine-story building just after 3 am. One person has been treated at the scene. Around 100 firefighters are involved in the operation.

title: Musk Threatens to Quit, Tesla Sets New $2T-$8.5T Compensation Goals

summary: Tesla's board revealed that CEO Elon Musk has threatened to quit multiple times, leading to a new compensation plan aimed at retaining him. This plan includes 12 market cap goals for Tesla, beginning at $2 trillion and potentially reaching up to $8.5 trillion.

title: New Method Converts PET Waste into CO2-Capturing Material
snippets: A team of chemists has discovered how to transform PET plastic waste into BAETA, a material that captures CO2 with remarkable efficiency. Instead of ending up as microplastics in the environment, discarded bottles and textiles could become tools to combat climate change. The method is energy-friendl

Chemists at the University of Copenhagen have developed a method to convert plastic waste into a climate solution for efficient and sustainable CO2 capture. This is killing two birds with one stone as they address two of the world's biggest challenges: plastic pollution and the climate crisis.
titles: Scientists made plastic that eats carbon
Scientists transform plastic waste into efficient CO‚ÇÇ capture materials
summary: Chemists at the University of Copenhagen have developed a method to convert PET plastic waste into BAETA, a material that efficiently captures CO2, addressing plastic pollution and climate change simultaneously. This innovative, energy-friendly process offers a dual solution to major environmental challenges.

title: Judge Dismisses Newsmax Antitrust Lawsuit Against Fox News
snippets: Judge dismisses Newsmax's antitrust lawsuit against Fox
Judge Aileen Cannon is best known for presiding over a criminal case against President Trump for retaining classified government records after his first term.

summary: US District Judge Aileen Cannon dismissed Newsmax's antitrust lawsuit against Fox News and its parent company, just two days after it was filed. Judge Cannon is known for overseeing a criminal case against President Trump related to classified records.

title: Warner Bros. Sues Midjourney Over Copyright Infringement Claims
snippets: Warner Bros. says that Midjourney knowingly engaged in wrongful conduct, noting that the company previously restricted subscribers from generating content based on infringing images but recently lifted those protections.
Warner Bros. case builds on arguments raised in a Disney/Universal lawsuit.
titles: Warner Bros. sues Midjourney for AI images of Superman, Batman, and other characters
Warner Bros. sues Midjourney to stop AI knockoffs of Batman, Scooby-Doo
summary: Warner Bros. accuses Midjourney of intentionally allowing users to generate content from copyrighted images after lifting previous restrictions. This case follows similar legal arguments made in a Disney/Universal lawsuit against Midjourney.
